messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a castle with 15 rooms. Room 1 is connected to room 7, room 10, room 13, and room 11. Room 2 is connected to room 5, room 8, room 11, and room 14. Room 3 is connected to room 6, room 9, room 12, and room 8. Room 4 is connected to room 7, room 10, room 13, and room 15. Room 5 is connected to room 8, room 11, and room 14. Room 6 is connected to room 9, room 12, and room 15. Room 7 is connected to room 10, and room 13. Room 8 is connected to room 14. Room 9 is connected to room 12 and room 15. Room 10 is connected to room 13. Room 11 is connected to room 14. Room 12 is connected to room 15. What is the shortest path from room 1 to room 7? Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

Answer: 1, 7, 5, 8, 11, 10, 6, 9, 12, 4, 13, 14

Watson Assistant is a conversational AI platform that lets you build virtual assistants that can understand natural language and interact with your customers.

I hope you enjoyed this post! If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out to me on Twitter and GitHub.

By the way, I am looking for a new opportunity and I would love to work with a great team on a great product. If you are looking for a strong backend developer feel free to contact me. Also, I have experience in leadership. If you are looking for a CTO or team leader, I would be happy to help.

Also, I have started creating YouTube videos about programming. Please subscribe to my YouTube channel so that I can improve the videos and do my best to provide high-quality content. Here is the YouTube video of this post:

It is not easy to come up with an algorithm that can provide the shortest path between two points. We can use the dijkstra algorithm to solve this problem. The dijkstra algorithm is a graph search algorithm that finds the shortest path from a given node to all other
